68474BE7FCD64762B2F90E44BC7A9BB6.description: Apply ethical and legal standards as they pertain to projects.

9A3EEA02F3DD45E2ADB55800C2B43F63.description: Identify existing or potential hazards to existing or assigned plans, projects or processes

4FB157982AB44B5FBF2569C25FF6B7E1.description: Apply appropriate safety and health practices when developing plans, projects, processes, or solving complex problems (e.g., OSHA, Fire Codes, Hazmat, etc).

70C3726C746943E58E0BA592014075F2.description: Develop an awareness of and apply safety, health and environmental practices using ethical and legal standards.

F819AFE5465F4D43BA012EC8F9A25E0D.description: Understand and demonstrate the importance of health, safety and environmental management systems in organizations and the importance of professional ethics and legal responsibilities.

C260339CCC1648A5963C14351B664180.description: Demonstrate sustainable practices used in modern construction.

35EE6A9627DB48D9B3CCC3A996CF1B2E.description: Explain the interchangeable systems of structural innovations.

98E1FA4716894F7EA0AB95FCD2DDF3D0.description: Distinguish and explain how buildings and structures generally contain a variety of subsystems as well as a subsystem of large infrastructures

909165E59C014AEF95EAE5EAF4624120.description: Understand and demonstrate the knowledge and skills required in Construction.

143F40A2EAB04DBBB9DDAB33CD03918F.description: Demonstrate how a mass production system and/or an assembly line incorporate interchangeable parts that increase the efficiency of the outcome.

DD0B370E2CC4434F8C49573D9D54E984.description: Differentiate among the individual qualities of materials (i.e., natural, synthetic, or mixed).

3D9F8BAA70CB419CA3D1C40FA61AB822.description: Categorize durable goods and non-durable goods.

37A5FDCC75204E3F96A5C63A9F855D2C.description: Identify types of manufacturing systems, (i.e. customized production, batch production, and continuous production).

301402CC898A4C27B7A72CA20E8A01E9.description: Understand and demonstrate the knowledge and skills required in Manufacturing.

B2B363541A764456A9FAA0119ED6A028.description: Demonstrate how transportation vehicles utilize subsystems that function together for the system to work effectively (e.g., structural propulsion, suspension, guidance, control, and support).

C7BBA3B2F6EC453195C0E32D8D364FEE.description: Explain how the design of intelligent and non-intelligent transportation systems depend on many processes and innovative techniques.

F123154A4736418095DE1BBC3F7F6015.description: Understand the role that transportation plays in the operation of other technologies, such as manufacturing, construction, communication, health and safety, and agriculture.

7F79C02E71804FEAB57857BE59CB4E48.description: Understand and demonstrate the knowledge and skills required in Transportation.

105482555D684625B836CCA9E1E41C56.description: Use technological knowledge and processes to communicate using symbols, measurement, conventions, icons, graphic images, and languages that incorporate a variety of visual, auditory, and tactile stimuli.

CA7EF58645A645AFBD3762775439EB23.description: Demonstrate how information and communication systems allow information to be transferred from human to human, human to machine, machine to human, and machine to machine.

DFBAFA88FCC242879D90425217C66295.description: Understand and demonstrate the knowledge and skills required in Communication.

F526912FB05E4C21A069A72DAE2FE1E3.description: Understand that power systems must have a source of energy, a process and loads.

0A36C8AC5E4749C591AB555E1F22E0FD.description: Differentiate among the major forms of power to determine the optimal source for solving a real world application (thermal, radiant, electrical, mechanical, chemical, nuclear, renewable and non renewable).

A275F3DBE90E4178844F3424EBC2B372.description: Understand and demonstrate the knowledge and skills required in Power and Energy.

ECC32CB2F4224D3BAB0B5FE3E7491376.description: Demonstrate an understanding that agriculture includes a combination of businesses that use a wide array of products and systems to produce, process, and distribute food and beverages, medicine, energy, the environment and genetic engineering.

D6F56DB6E1B145078C351827085A2F3E.description: Understand and demonstrate the knowledge and skills required in Agriculture.

A828C95C60B2476C85522746CCD1F51E.description: Identify and distinguish among medical technologies used in prevention and rehabilitation, vaccines and pharmaceuticals, medical and surgical procedures, genetic engineering, and the systems within which health is protected and maintained.

4646F126A6A04C14B4A01EB85A337325.description: Understand and demonstrate the knowledge and skills required in Biotechnology.

F9F944E550F74970AB5BD40E9E6AAB97.description: Apply tools, materials and processes to manipulate and connect our designed world through the technology areas.

60C45B8E4F864DE9A4AA444AB6444712.description: Use verbal and non verbal techniques to communicate information.

3DE77925F701461D857200B03EC21B31.description: Evaluate final solutions and communicate observation, processes, and results of the entire design process, using verbal, graphic, quantitative, virtual, and written means, in addition to three-dimensional models.

212E384D181241A9A9F75C56AAF3E3A0.description: Use teamwork and leadership skills effectively.

5CB664B5A6F34650BA9C4B7CDE80328C.description: Demonstrate the ability to collaborate and work effectively with others.

2607D53B79074719BF20BC032B23156C.description: Understand the engineering profession has developed well tested sets of rules and design principles that provide a systematic approach as well as an ability to quantify the design process in order to improve efficiency.

794A2B1781BD44BA9D9CB5F857D99C1D.description: Understand the engineer's role in the design process.

A30F346DA2834C5088F16E21F21A82CC.description: Explain that it involves the knowledge of the mathematical and natural sciences that are gained by study, experience and practice.

124671860BB8496DADCA5211CBF93EFA.description: Understand that modeling, testing, evaluating, and modifying are used to transform ideas into practical solutions.

19D37BA419E24FCE8600F1872DD56845.description: Use tools to evaluate and select materials and processes for the design cycle.

F3A3EC9B13B4491387A9DF9E19DE909F.description: Understand and apply tools, materials and processes of technology.

88F86DB978B741A0996D80E1FD7169D8.description: Understand and demonstrate engineering design by applying the design process and assessing the impact of systems.

61D560C6823344E681ED09EBDA307ADB.description: Use assessment techniques, such as trend analysis and experimentation, to make decisions about the future development of technology.

D2B2A1F64CEA4C19BB38AAB7AE47827F.description: Synthesize data, analyze trends, and draw conclusions regarding the effect of technology on the individual, society, and environment.

EBA2A31F1BBF4893A079D637B5D5C896.description: Understand that the design needs to be continually checked and critiqued, and the ideas of the design must be redefined and improved.

99620F22B97E4A508D8B91508E38A2D7.description: Select an approach, develop a design proposal, make a model or prototype, test and evaluate the design using specifications, refine the design, create or make it, and communicate processes and results.

DCCE823C44234D2EB7DF89FFD4C3AFE4.description: Demonstrate the design process by defining a problem, brainstorming, researching and generating ideas, identifying criteria and specifying constraints, and exploring possibilities.

749F85C7D9814F8D83CBB713571A8715.description: Explain how the requirements of a design, such as criteria, constraints, and efficiencies sometimes compete with each other.

8C88720A806A401EB70C1DEE5E181C87.description: Understand that design is a creative planning process that leads to useful products and systems.

8B820C2F685640D394629C647934F122.description: Apply criteria and constraints of materials, processes and tools to a design.

929A27F2E9A3483EB3ACE9248753430D.description: Use tools to manipulate materials through the design cycle.

1A2FBECD5B0D4ECCAA826A673257DFB5.description: Understand and apply tools, materials and processes of technology.

2236E6DD9B2E452B9DE057B7A22FDF3F.description: Understand and demonstrate the attributes of design by applying the design process and assessing the impact of bringing a product to market.

689D882DE201406C8AA3D71346643DCC.description: Understand the definitions of invention and innovation. (i.e., Invention is a process of turning ideas and imagination into devices and systems and Innovation is the process of modifying an existing product or system to improve it).

A35C460F3B83450D8AEA25910857B156.description: Understand community and environmental needs and their long-term impact. (i.e., not in my back yard vs. imminent domain).

BEBE185BB71E4A37909A69DC5B94F531.description: Clarify the meanings of invention and innovation.

D4DB81811B114EF19006E257D46F1AD3.description: Categorize sequences as arithmetic, geometric, or neither and develop formulas for the general terms related to arithmetic and geometric sequences using tables, graphs, symbols, text, and geometric models.

B1A7FA7A4601400F9ECCCA436C213B8D.description: Demonstrate the relationship between all representations of linear functions using point-slope, slope-intercept, and standard form of a line through tables, graphs, symbols, text, and geometric models.

D05EB3A87E3F47E5B47159BC041E90BA.description: Evaluate the efficiency of a variety of energy transformations.

5A316161D0AD4C03912F5D4AF7781A72.description: Utilize research in solving technological problems.

DA7226E76E4A4C16A3AD4E99089A0D2C.description: Apply a specific problem solving approach that is used intensively in business and industry to prepare devices and systems for the marketplace.

7DE54FA55EDC4E7BBED155BCE82D4C8D.description: Apply research and development in problem solving.

ACE0B65761D841A2BA1D62A800B27945.description: Develop new ideas to solve and eliminate recurring issues.

50D64DEA1BAD42F6BF8A2D3C36F9C52E.description: Gather, analyze and interpret data and graphs regarding position, velocity and acceleration of moving objects.

5E86B281A3BC4BDEB21BF6FCF10498BA.description: Analyze and interpret prior knowledge of tools, materials and processes to create a plan of action.

1757380D86B6473390FD895F28076A60.description: Gather knowledge to correct issues relevant to use and preventative maintenance. (the noisy belt, leaking window, screws to repair human joints, Hubble telescope).

293974CF3C2C44FE89C82C370A070B24.description: Implement trouble shooting techniques in problem solving.

40CC01AC25AF47ED85B8273A65330A4C.description: Develop an understanding of counting techniques to solve problems in real world contexts.

A4FADB9E9CCD4EA39EBC72C47C3D7936.description: Gather, analyze and interpret data on the quantity of energy in a system or object using appropriate measurements, equations and graphs.

FAAE3308F9C2487EB7BC71E3F587DF04.description: Recognize the multidisciplinary approach in solving technological problems.

173204134AEE478EB2AA552F351A202B.description: Understand and apply tools, materials and processes of technology.

971C15A0772A48E4AF5B11599B428C95.description: Develop and demonstrate an understanding of the role of troubleshooting, research and development, invention and innovation, and experimentation in problem solving.

AF14E0C724074AA89674CE77F7F36376.description: Identify changes in society and the creation of new needs and wants to the process of invention and innovation.

813B541E41544379B41E165DE1A45093.description: Apply the process of inventions and innovations.

E7558D6FB64E4E85947B3B5DD8898FA1.description: Learn that most technological development has been evolutionary, the result a series of refinements to a basic invention.

7BECCD053B564D2DB0BFDE5362B10D6A.description: Explain the acceptance and use of products and systems.

E8B51DD0AA7B45A680AFD83B6132E925.description: Identify factors that contribute to the design and demand for various technologies (e.g. economy, fads, and advertising).

0038A35ED7504E8695CEE3B83BE45360.description: Chronicle technology development throughout history and the forces that were apparent during the historical timeline from the Iron Age to the Information Age.

32F03010E0EC41C8944D04ADD3B6DCBA.description: Understand how development is driven by demands, values, and interests.

1FA2A2D55E644A33A023F43051C062F1.description: Understand that just as the Iron Age was defined by the use of iron, the information age is evolving the use of information as a resource.

08017C3FC9AC4719A81E17E580EEED47.description: Understand that the design and construction of structures have evolved from the development of techniques for measurement, controlling systems, and the understanding of special relationships.

1EB9131C3DA84A8AB76FC7B3D733FD33.description: Explain the evolution of techniques, measurement, and resources.

0C64182737A141A896CA9C88637FA3CE.description: Trace the development and use of tools and materials through the evolution of civilization.

293B1AEB43DB4BE9AD0302B657D98B44.description: Develop an understanding of the factors that drive technological development (e.g. social and cultural priorities as well as the acceptance and use of products and systems).

F79C9CD499314863B84E350C79EC6D13.description: Understand and apply tools, materials and processes of technology.

007605FE47614058B0DDAA209B61F56E.description: Understand and demonstrate the influence of technology on history and the societal role in the development and use of technology.

69A76C123146401D8EDBD21861D946B3.description: Think critically, analyze evidence, read graphs, understand logical arguments, detect logical fallacies, test conjectures, evaluate risks, and appreciate the role mathematics plays in the modern world, i.e., be quantitatively literate.

EB8979F44D6C4AFA835646E8A012F8D3.description: Apply the knowledge of natural science and mathematics gained by study, experience and practice applied with creativity and judgment.

C3952ECE26F04CC299AE479AE8973AC3.description: Understand the impact of technology on cultural, social, economic, and political changes.

613FBDA98C414245A684F73DA72DDDB2.description: Develop an appreciation for the vast relationships in technology and how future developments and society's well being is dependent on how well technology is understood, developed, used and restricted.

EE4E9F7D1BC745BA87DDD12E0C964CA4.description: Explain how making decisions about the use of technology involves weighing the trade-offs between the positive and negative effects.

824AA60786274FE1891ADC3B129B3350.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the environmental consequences of technology.

4343CE426D9E4E9E998742D8C64BF674.description: Explain how humans devise technologies to reduce the negative consequence of other technologies. (e.g. expanded use of recycling and new processes such as deconstruction vs. demolition).

1C5F0546EFD74E82AB8B0FC8CF81BB7E.description: Understand why the management of waste produced from technological systems is an important societal issue.

92C797E9D0D6451DAB5F3BE124FD2B79.description: Understand and apply tools, materials and processes of technology.

2DDD9F423F2B49FB8927BC2AA3D05FB7.description: Understand and demonstrate the cultural, social, economic, political and environmental effects of technology.

4527D9116D244022B0A541CDA47571B4.description: Find solutions to equations involving power and exponential functions; solve these equations graphically or numerically or algebraically using calculators, graphing utilities or other.

102E96445D254037B956B1073A5845FD.description: Use appropriate computation methods that encompasses estimation, calculation, and degree of precision.

CCD8D45BFDB84EDC9C9D0F3AAB63BD54.description: Develop, communicate and justify an evidence based scientific explanation regarding the potential or kinetic nature of a type of energy.

9BF48E00E2EA4052A9779E4F8A4998FC.description: Gather, analyze and interpret data on chemical and physical properties of elements (e.g., density, melting point, boiling point, pH, conductivity).

08AA984B48764529B7F01AC80F4B3729.description: Use mathematical principals to analyze the application of an existing material or system with the goal of improving and modifying it.

FF667DE54B61496690D82DF481794B47.description: Develop, communicate, and justify an evidence-based scientific prediction regarding the effects of the action-reaction force pairs on the motion of two interacting objects.

AB6DCA160A4A4162B057E68355A76BEE.description: Synthesize and apply technological knowledge and advances of science and mathematics.

99AFB70D3C424496926F6BCE87C1F8C6.description: Apply invention as a process of connecting science, technology and math, along with materials, tools and innovation to create breakthrough devices, tools and systems.

AF6DDD4235784ABBBE343A7DBBEA5851.description: Understand and apply tools, materials and processes.

568A39A7BD284DDB92338EB83A5EAE9E.description: Understand and demonstrate the relationships among technologies and the connections between technology and other fields of study.

394B9457576645EE8A9A017CD3AB29FC.description: Apply knowledge of scientific development to solve real world technical applications.

7F07968136F44AF980D89086CC4FEDEC.description: Effectively use project management techniques (including, but not limited to, time management practices, effective organizational skills, conduct analysis of cost, resources, and production capability and quality practices with continuous improvement.

1BA08826A9A84DBC8856418C9011CF5E.description: Describe the elements of good engineering practice (e.g. understanding customer needs, planning requirements, analysis, using appropriate tools and materials, prototyping, test, evaluation and verification.

2B9F952882E1419DA36D50E69BF197A6.description: Demonstrate the ability to characterize a plan and identify the necessary tools that will produce a technical solution when given a problem statement.

D1FB44BA91234892BC0FB2512B5B4B36.description: Identify and apply the core concepts of technology.

0670C9F47BA5450BA40EAD3F5A6C12B9.description: Demonstrate the ability to formulate results by the collection and interpretation of data.

CDDE8762FF3C408C8891406AE2B29C38.description: Use the appropriate technology to determine scope.

1D5DD0D81BC8408ABC1F8136FDF52ED5.description: Analyze rate, goal and commercialization of technology through a production process.

D6F28F53BD68428CAB0411CF716F825D.description: Interpret of results of a study, including inferences and predictions. Define and explain the meaning of significance (both practical and statistical).

B2B09D0037A34AE6A9FCDC50425D50D5.description: Apply and create an appropriate process for an assigned situation to solve a real world problem, using tools and materials.

D3B099AD19C34B479D91D33F601E8E18.description: Understand and apply tools, materials and processes.

4BE187C9C15144A290BDCF9AAEB973C9.description: Understand and demonstrate the characteristics, scope and core concepts of technology.
